elements.title: Kabwe mine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Kabwe mine produced crystals and a fossilised pre-human skull (replica pictured), and has poisoned hundreds of thousands of people?

elements.title: Alix Earle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that social media influencer Alix Earle's first video on TikTok featured her and her friends showcasing outfits they had made out of trash bags?

elements.title: Thai typewriter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first Thai typewriter left out two letters, which eventually became obsolete?

elements.title: Eduardo Maldonado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after his candidacy was disqualified by Bolivia's electoral court, Eduardo Maldonado sued the state at the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights and won?

elements.title: 2013 Midwest floods (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the 2013 Midwest floods, lightning struck a plane on the runway, according to officials at the airport?

elements.title: Tan See Boo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chinese missionary Tan See Boo moved to Singapore to work for the Presbyterian Church, but later returned to China to persuade Christians to leave the Presbyterian Church?

elements.title: X-Pyr (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that of 42 pilot competitors who started the 2022 X-Pyr, a paragliding hike-and-fly endurance race, only four reached the final goal?

elements.title: Bird Thomas Baldwin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bird Thomas Baldwin, the director of the first child research center of its kind, died due to a shaving accident?
